Foreman;John Wiley & Sons;2013-10-31;2013;english;Technology | Business | Nonfiction | Computer Science | Programming | Computers;409;Paperback;"Data Science gets thrown around in the press like it's magic. Major retailers are predicting everything from when their customers are pregnant to when they want a new pair of Chuck Taylors. It's a brave new world where seemingly meaningless data can be transformed into valuable insight to drive smart business decisions.
But how does one exactly do data science? Do you have to hire one of these priests of the dark arts
column3: to extract this gold from your data? Nope.

column1: Data science is little more than using straight-forward steps to process raw data into actionable insight. And in Data Smart
column2: author and data scientist John Foreman will show you how that's done within the familiar environment of a spreadsheet.

column1: Why a spreadsheet? It's comfortable! You get to look at the data every step of the way
column2: building confidence as you learn the tricks of the trade. Plus
column3: spreadsheets are a vendor-neutral place to learn data science without the hype.

column1: But don't let the Excel sheets fool you. This is a book for those serious about learning the analytic techniques
Each chapter will cover a different technique in a spreadsheet so you can follow along:

column2: including non-linear programming and genetic algorithms

column3: and prediction intervals through monte carlo simulation

column1: - Moving from spreadsheets into the R programming language
You get your hands dirty as you work alongside John through each technique. But never fear
column2: the topics are readily applicable and the author laces humor throughout. You'll even learn what a dead squirrel has to do with optimization modeling
column3: which you no doubt are dying to know.";4.12;1015;;;goodreads;https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/17682206;2025-11-21T00:07:15.267233;

column1: 9781647826314;9781647826314;1647826314;Mindmasters: The Data-Driven Science of Predicting and Changing Human Behavior;mindmasters the datadriven science of predicting and changing human behavior;Sandra Matz | SANDRA. MATZ;Sandra Matz;Harvard Business Review Press;2025-01-07;2025;english;Psychology | Technology | Business | Nonfiction | Sociology | Business & Economics;240;Hardcover;"A refreshingly relatable exploration of how algorithms penetrate the most intimate aspects of our psychology
column2: and how we can regain mastery over our lives—from the pioneering expert of psychological targeting.

column1: There are more digital pieces of data than stars in the universe. This data helps us monitor our planet
column3: and take a deep dive into our psychology.

column1: As algorithms become increasingly adept at accessing our minds
column2: they also become more and more powerful at controlling it—enticing us to buy a certain product or vote for a certain political candidate. Some of us say this technological trend is no big deal. Others consider it one of the greatest threats to humanity. But what if the truth is more nuanced and mind-bending than that?

Columbia Business School professor Sandra Matz offers a fascinating insider perspective on the art and data-driven science of psychological targeting. By relating her own personal story of growing up in a small village—where few aspects of life remain truly private—to her groundbreaking research in computational psychology
column3: Matz reveals how Big Data offers insights into the most intimate aspects of our psyche and how these insights empower external influence over the choices we make.

column1: Filled with Ted-Talk-like explanations and real-life examples from Matz's research and consulting work
column2: Mindmasters paints a nuanced picture of the power of psychological targeting. Like nosy neighbors
column5: and downright harmful—with scandals like Cambridge Analytica being merely the tip of the iceberg. Yet
column8: it also holds enormous potential to help us live healthier and happier lives—for example
column11: or enabling us to break out of our echo chambers.

column2: Matz shows us how to manage psychological targeting and redesign the data game in a way that empowers us to take back control and ask more of our personal data.

column1: Mindmasters is a riveting look at what our digital footprints reveal about us
column2: how they're being used—for good and for ill—and how we can gain more control and power over the data that define us.";4.04;290;;;goodreads;https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/205905685;2025-11-21T00:07:22.196873;
